intro: Acinos alpinus var. dinaricus, commonly known as the Dinaric acino, is a perennial flowering plant native to the Balkan Peninsula. It belongs to the family Rosaceae and is characterized by its compact growth habit and hairy foliage. The plant produces small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in early summer. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to high-altitude environments. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species in its native range.
